snippet: The board chairman of Interfaith Medical Center blames Wyckoff Heights Medical Center, another ailing hospital, for delaying a rescue plan.
abstract: Interfaith Medical Center in Brooklyn says it is running out of cash and fears it will not be able to make its payroll or pay its vendors without a state bailout; blames Wyckoff Heights Medical Center, another ailing area hospital, for delaying a plan to shore up operations that would have combined Interfaith, Wyckoff and Brooklyn Hospital Center in Fort Greene.
lead_paragraph: The board chairman of Interfaith Medical Center blames Wyckoff Heights Medical Center, another ailing hospital, for delaying a rescue plan.

headline.seo: Interfaith Medical Center in Brooklyn Says It May Need State Bailout
headline.main: A Brooklyn Hospital, Low on Cash, Says It May Need a State Bailout
headline.print_headline: A Brooklyn Hospital, Low on Cash, Says It May Need a State Bailout
